src.java.index

Class InvertedIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.java.index.InvertedIndex

  • public class InvertedIndex
extends java.lang.Object
    A data structure that represents an invertedIndex that stores how many times a term appears in each file along with the document id. Each invertedIndex entry points to a list of Postings.
    Since:
    09-27-2017
    See Also:
    Posting

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InvertedIndex()
      Constructs an empty invertedIndex.

      • addNormalizedScore

        public void addNormalizedScore(java.lang.String term,
                               int docID,
                               double score)
        Maps a term to a certain score for a document.
        Parameters:
        term - The term where the score will be associated to
        docID - The id of the document
        score - The score of the document

      • addTokenOccurrence

        public void addTokenOccurrence(java.lang.String token,
                               int docID)
        Adds an occurrence of a token in a document with a certain ID to the index.
        Parameters:
        token - A word/token, its occurrence will be stored in the index.
        docID - The ID of the document where the token appeared.

      • getPostings

        public java.util.Set<Posting> getPostings(java.lang.String term)
        Parameters:
        term - the term to which the postings are associated
        Returns:
        The Set of Posting objects associated with the term, or null in case the term is not in the index

      • addTermAndPostings

        public void addTermAndPostings(java.lang.String term,
                               java.util.Set<Posting> postings)
        Parameters:
        term - A term to which the values will be mapped
        postings - A Set of Posting objects associated with the term

      • vocabularySize

        public int vocabularySize()
        Returns the size of the invertedIndex vocabulary which corresponds to the number of terms in the invertedIndex.
        Returns:
        The size of the vocabulary that is indexed.
